@clawedthecat this happened because mp4s are more modern formats and give a better picture quality in smaller sizes but they do not play on most devices like dvd players, PS3, ect.

mp4 produces a better quality picture as well as a finished smaller file size compared to AVI's of the same.  This in turn saves bandwidth when downloading movies and or TV shows.

Sadly those of us that still use older computers with out dated video cards, experience a video that plays back jerky and sometimes stops and starts because of the compression, memory and CPU etc.

That's one of the reasons people still prefer AVI (XviD).  Others just don't like change and why fix it if it ain't broke!
